intro: Cerastium brachypetalum var. eglandulosum, commonly known as the glandular mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, glandular hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with five petals, and bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
